meanings.definition: The first page of a newspaper or website that displays the most important news stories.
meanings.sent1: I always check the frontpages of the newspaper to see the latest news.
meanings.sent2: The frontpages of the website are updated daily with breaking stories.
meanings.sent3: The frontpages of the newspaper were so exciting today that I couldn't stop reading.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes scanned the frontpages of the newspaper, searching for any familiar names.
meanings.sent5: The frontpages of the website were like a window to the world's events.

meanings.definition: To place on the front page of a newspaper or website.
meanings.sent1: The editor decided to frontpages the breaking news story for maximum impact.
meanings.sent2: She frontpages the article about the charity event to attract more readers.
meanings.sent3: I jokingly told my friend I would frontpages his photo on the newspaper's front page.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work was so impressive that it deserved to be frontpagesd in the art section.
meanings.sent5: The team agreed to frontpages the important announcement to ensure it gets noticed.
